criteria: Ability to accurately find derivatives of parametrically defined functions.
Competence in applying implicit differentiation to solve problems.
Skill in applying calculus concepts to real-world problems in physics, chemistry, and economics.
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of parametric functions or derivatives.
Student attempts to find derivatives but makes significant errors in understanding parametric functions or derivative rules.
Student can find derivatives of simple parametric functions but struggles with more complex examples.
Student can find derivatives of most parametric functions with some minor errors.
Student accurately finds derivatives of a wide range of parametric functions with minimal errors.
Student expertly and accurately finds derivatives of complex parametric functions, demonstrating a strong understanding of the underlying concepts.
Student shows no understanding of implicit differentiation.
Student attempts implicit differentiation but demonstrates significant errors in the process.
Student can perform implicit differentiation on simple equations but struggles with more complex scenarios.
Student applies implicit differentiation to solve most problems but may make some algebraic errors.
Student accurately applies implicit differentiation to solve a variety of problems with minimal errors.
Student expertly and accurately applies implicit differentiation in complex and novel problems, demonstrating a deep understanding of the technique.
Student is unable to apply calculus concepts to any real-world problems.
Student attempts to apply calculus concepts but demonstrates a fundamental misunderstanding of the problem or relevant calculus techniques.
Student can apply calculus to solve very basic real-world problems with significant guidance.
Student can apply calculus to solve some real-world problems but struggles with complexity or interdisciplinary connections.
Student applies calculus concepts to solve a variety of real-world problems with reasonable accuracy and understanding.
Student expertly applies calculus concepts to solve complex, interdisciplinary real-world problems, demonstrating a sophisticated understanding of the relationship between calculus and other fields.
